result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mykale A Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mykale A Johnson in court.  Attorney Martin Joseph Pruhs in court for Mykale A Johnson.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Benjamin Ade, Milwaukee Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Mykale A Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney Martin Joseph Pruhs appeared by video for Mykale A Johnson.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status of Counsel held.  Attorney Pruhs was recently retained.  Court removes attorney De Leon as counsel of record.  Defense counsel requests preliminary hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 094324,
Payable Number: 1036734,
Receipt Number: 22RP039859,
Amount: $20.00
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Mykale A Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defendant still wishes to retain private counsel.  Court will allow defendant 2 weeks to hire counsel.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Mykale A Johnson in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  State's witness appeared in court.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel on this case.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for level 3 supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT immediately upon leaving court.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.   Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (July 24th, 2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Mykale A Johnson in court with attorney Martin Joseph Pruhs.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
